Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class StringMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.common.StringMethods
  • public final class StringMethods
extends Object
    Methods for working with strings. This class tries to avoid duplicating the functionality already present in Apache Commons and Google Guava, but since the naturalis-common library as a whole is designed to be self-contained, that is not always possible. All methods are null-safe for the String being inspected or manipulated (usually named subject). They also never return null unless otherwise indicated. The string to be inspected or manipulated is always passed in as an argument of type Object. If the argument is null, an empty string is returned (in most cases). Otherwise inspection or manipulation is done on the string resulting from Object.toString.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static String EMPTY
      The empty string.

      • endsWith

        public static String endsWith​(Object subject,
                              boolean ignoreCase,
                              Collection<String> suffixes)
        Whether or not the provided string ends with any of the provided suffixes. They suffixes must not be null. They may be empty, but endsWith always returns false for them.
        Parameters:
        subject - The string to test
        ignoreCase - Whether or not to ignore case
        suffixes - The suffixes to test

      • endsWith

        public static String endsWith​(Object subject,
                              boolean ignoreCase,
                              String... suffixes)
        Whether or not subject ends with any of the provided suffixes. Returns the first suffix found to be equals to the end of the string, or null if thr string ended in none of the provided suffixes.
        Parameters:
        subject -
        ignoreCase -
        suffixes -

      • lpad

        public static String lpad​(Object obj,
                          int width,
                          String terminator)
        Left-pads a string to the specified width using the space character (' ') and then appends the specified terminator.
        Parameters:
        obj - An object whose toString() method produces the string to be padded. Null is treated as the empty string.
        width - The total length of the padded string. If the string itself is wider than the specified width, the string is printed without padding.
        terminator - The delimiter to append to the left-padded string.
        Returns:
        The left-padded string
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If terminator is null

      • lpad

        width - The total length of the padded string. If the string itself is wider than the specified width, the string is printed without padding.
        Returns:
        The left-padded string

        Parameters:
        subject - The String to trim
        c - The character to trim off the String
        Returns:
        The left-trimmed String or the input string if it did not start with the specified character

      • ltrim

        public static String ltrim​(Object subject,
                           String chars)

        Parameters:
        subject - The String to trim
        chars - The character to trim off the String
        Returns:
        The left-trimmed String or the input string if it did not start with any of the specified characters

                         char padChar)
        Centers (left- and right-pads) a string within the specified width using the specified padding character.
        Parameters:
        obj - An object whose toString() method produces the string to be padded. Null is treated as the empty string.
        width - The total length of the padded string. If the string itself is wider than the specified width, the string is printed without padding.
        padChar - The character used to left- and right-pad the string.
        Returns:
        The left- and right-padded string plus the terminator

        Parameters:

        c - The character to trim off the String

      • substr

        public static String substr​(Object subject,
                            int from)
        Substring method that allows substring retrieval relative to the end of a string. See substr(Object, int, int).
        Parameters:
        subject - The String to extract a substring from
        from - The start index within string (may be negative)
        Returns:
        The substring

      • substr

        public static String substr​(Object subject,
                            int from,
                            int length)
        Substring method that allows for substring retrieval relative to the end of a string. The length argument will be clamped to remain with the bounds of the string.

        substr(null, 1, 5) "" (empty string)
        substr("Hello", 200, 3) "" (empty string)
        substr("Hello", 2, 0) "" (empty string)
        substr("Hello", 2, -2) "" (empty string)
        substr("Hello", -2, 100) "lo"
        substr("Hello", -4, 3) "ell"
        substr("Hello", -400, 3) "Hel"
        substr("Hello", 1, 3) "ell"
        substr("Hello", 1, 300) "ello"
        Parameters:
        subject - The String to extract a substring from
        from - The start index within string (may be negative)
        length - The length the substring
        Returns:
        The substring

      • substr

        public static String substr​(Object subject,
                            String until,
                            boolean first)
        Returns everything up to (not including) the first or last occurence of until within the string, or the entire string if it does not contain until.
        Parameters:
        subject - The string to take a substring from
        until - The string up until which to take the substring
        first - Whether to use the first of last occurrence of until
        Returns:
        The substring

      • substr

        public static String substr​(Object subject,
                            char until,
                            boolean first)
        Returns everything up to (not including) the first or last occurence of until within the string, or the entire string if it does not contain until.
        Parameters:
        subject - The string to take a substring from
        until - The string up until which to take the substring
        first - Whether to use the first of last occurrence of until
        Returns:
        The substring
